race.name: Swamp Fox Gravel Fondo
race.tagline: South Carolina coastal forest gravel in Francis Marion NF.

vitals.location: Francis Marion National Forest, South Carolina

climate.description: Variable conditions with heat and humidity possible.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Francis Marion National Forest. Minimal elevation with forest/swamp scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional SC event. Coastal forest terrain with minimal elevation and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Swamp Fox Gravel Fondo is a regional event in Francis Marion National Forest, South Carolina—coastal forest terrain with minimal elevation. The forest/swamp scenery is unique, but the minimal climbing, moderate organization, and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. Heat and humidity are major challenges.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional South Carolina gravel race with unique coastal forest terrain. Worth it for South Carolina cyclists seeking a flat forest event. Not a destination race for out-of-state travelers.

final_verdict.one_liner: South Carolina coastal forest gravel in Francis Marion NF.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in South Carolina and want a flat forest event—yes, it's solid. If you're from out of state or want climbing—look elsewhere.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better SC events: Gran Fondo Hincapie, Race to Valhalla. For similar flat events: other coastal gravel races.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Charleston area has good lodging options.
logistics.food: Charleston has full dining. Stock nutrition.

course_description.character: Flat coastal forest gravel with minimal elevation.
course_description.signature_challenge: Coastal forest endurance with heat and humidity.
course_description.ridewithgps_name: Swamp Fox Gravel Fondo 2024 50 Mile Route

guide_variables.race_location: Francis Marion National Forest, South Carolina

non_negotiables.why: Minimal elevation means sustained flat riding endurance.
Coastal SC heat and humidity are brutal.

topics.heat: Racing in extreme SC coastal heat

marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Regional event with flat forest terrain.

logistics.explanation: Registration caps at 300 riders across all distances, but organizers warn "We no longer mark our courses. Riders should download the course GPX file to their navigation device." The Francis Marion forest location offers minimal cell reception and no sag support - "There is no SAG wagon to pick you up. If you leave the course, we may not be able to find you."

length.explanation: 65 miles creates solid endurance challenge with 5-hour cutoffs for the shorter option. Heather Hart describes the 177.6-mile Moultrie Militia version: "Sure, 177.6 miles is a long way to ride your bike, but we kept our effort in an easy Z1 and below the entire time." Multiple distance options from 27 miles to the overnight raid provide scaling challenges. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Forest roads range from "prime condition for riding, fast and smooth" to problem areas like Old Georgetown road which is "a little sandier than ideal" and Forest Murrell Road "slowly being reabsorbed by the forest itself." Hell Hole Road A proved particularly troublesome where one rider's chain jammed so badly "it took at least 5 minutes to get it unstuck." Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: 1500 feet over 65 miles averages minimal climbing in South Carolina's coastal plain. Francis Marion National Forest sits near sea level with "rolling short steep hills" rather than sustained climbs. The terrain allows riders to maintain steady pacing in easy Zone 1 efforts according to race reports. Flatter profile than Croatan Buck Fifty.

climate.explanation: March 2025 conditions were ideal with "absolutely perfect temperature - a balmy 60 degrees with light wind and a bit of fog/mist in the air." However, past years brought "cold temperatures and demoralizing rain" creating course mud pits. The remote forest location means limited cell reception during weather emergencies. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Francis Marion National Forest operates at sea level in South Carolina's coastal plain near Charleston. Zero altitude considerations affect performance or acclimatization across all distance options from the 27-mile route to the 177.6-mile overnight raid. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The 177.6-mile overnight Moultrie Militia option starts at 11 PM, creating nocturnal forest experiences with active Barred Owls and remote roads where "we are on one of the most remote roads out there." Revolutionary War history connects riders to Francis Marion's guerrilla warfare tactics, but minimal support infrastructure limits backcountry immersion.

prestige.explanation: Multi-day festival format includes Friday brewery packet pickup at Commonhouse Aleworks and Sunday "Dirt Church" recovery rides sponsored by Trek Bicycle Store. The 177.6-mile overnight raid attracts only 16 starters from nearly 450 weekend registrants, suggesting niche regional appeal rather than national drawing power.

race_quality.explanation: Clear cutoff protocols (5 hours for 50 miles, 16 hours for the overnight raid) and aid station placement show organizational competence. Post-race food trucks serve empanadas and Filipino cuisine while riders "share their stories of #gravelfreedom." However, unmarked courses requiring GPS navigation and minimal support infrastructure limit race infrastructure quality.

experience.explanation: Francis Marion's Revolutionary War history and weekend festival atmosphere create memorable experiences beyond racing. Heather Hart describes the forest as "one of my most favorite places on earth...even more magical at night." Multi-day programming from Friday brewery socializing to Sunday recovery rides builds authentic weekend community around shared adventure.

community.explanation: Post-race atmosphere encourages riders to "hangout in the finish area and share their stories of #gravelfreedom" around food trucks serving empanadas and Filipino cuisine. Weekend programming spans Friday brewery visits through Sunday "Dirt Church" recovery rides, creating sustained community interaction beyond individual race efforts.

field_depth.explanation: The 100-mile event drew 58 starters in 2024 with a 7% DNF rate, showing modest regional participation. The overnight raid attracted only 16 riders from nearly 450 weekend registrants, indicating limited competitive depth. South Carolina's developing gravel scene provides regional competition without national-level talent concentration. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: $175 entry includes finisher awards, post-event food, and access to multi-day programming from Friday brewery events to Sunday recovery rides. Under-26 discount at $67.50 shows budget awareness. The weekend festival format maximizes value for travel investment with course preview rides and extensive community programming.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $60-100. Huger, SC location near Charleston provides reasonable lodging costs with accessible airport connections. March timing avoids peak tourist season pricing while delivering ideal riding weather - "absolutely perfect temperature" according to recent participants. Multi-day festival format from Friday through Sunday maximizes travel investment value. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.
